channel.title: Is do-x client or server sided
channel.description:
does ne1 know if the do-x feature is server or client sided? in other words, does the server ask u if you want to do-x and tell then itself to repeat the action x times, or does the client ask you and and tells the server x times to do something?
for example, with the new string-x, its actually slower cos each time you want to string manually, u have to go through a menu. the new string-x does it for u, but its slower than what ppl could click.
if its client sided, then it would be possible 2 remove it or edit it so its faster.

item.title: Is do-x client or server sided
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

The stringing was always imediatly, now it cost a bit longer, but no one cares, cause stringing always caused you RSI

Read full topic
item.source: Is do-x client or server sided

item.title: Is do-x client or server sided
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

no, actions take a certain amount of time to perform, manually “doing-x” lots will not be faster than the automatic option

Read full topic
item.source: Is do-x client or server sided

item.title: Is do-x client or server sided
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

autoer on wheels!:

if its client sided, then it would be possible 2 remove it or edit it so its faster.

I only read the last line of your post, but the answer is no.

Read full topic
item.source: Is do-x client or server sided

item.title: Is do-x client or server sided
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

oo you say the “X” option in, lets say putting things in bank? the server asks the client, after the client sends the action of you clicking “X”, and then the client sends the number that you put in, to the server

also it is posible to remove it, you could make it so that when the client recives the “show the chat thing so the player can put in numbers” packet, the client can automaticly send out a number like 99 or something.

Read full topic
item.source: Is do-x client or server sided
